#summary Getting Started page.

==Dependencies==

PoHessian depends on the modules Foundation and Net from [http://pocoproject.org Poco].

Using Debian, for example, you can get it using:
{{{
$ sudo apt-get install libpoco-dev
}}}

If you need to build it from source, here is its [http://pocoproject.org/download/index.html download] page. Read the [http://poco.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/poco/poco/branches/poco-1.4.3/README Poco README].

==Get the code==

Download the [http://code.google.com/p/pohessian/downloads/detail?name=pohessian-1.0.tar.gz latest source package].

==Unzip==

{{{
$ tar -xzf pohessian-1.0.tar.gz
$ cd pohessian-1.0
}}}

==Compile==

{{{
$ ./configure
$ make
$ make check #optional
}}}

This will output (on Darwin):

{{{
$ ls -p1 .libs/libpohessian.*
.libs/libpohessian.0.0.0.dylib
.libs/libpohessian.0.dylib
.libs/libpohessian.a
.libs/libpohessian.dylib
.libs/libpohessian.la
.libs/libpohessian.lai
}}}

==Install==

{{{
$ sudo make install
}}}

On Linux you probably will need to do a `ldconfig`:

{{{
$ sudo ldconfig
}}}

==Use==

Here is a simple working bit of code that call the method `"String replyString_32()"` on the URL `"http://hessian.caucho.com/test/test2"`.

_main.cpp_
{{{
#include <iostream>
#include "Poco/URI.h"
#include "pohessian/HessianTypes.h"
#include "pohessian/HessianClient.h"

using namespace std;
using namespace Poco;
using namespace PoHessian;

int main()
{
    URI uri("http://hessian.caucho.com/test/test2");
    HessianClient client(HessianClient::HESSIAN_VERSION_1, uri);
    cout << client.call("replyString_32")->getString() << endl;
    return 0;
}
}}}

Compile the code:

{{{
$ g++ main.cpp -lpohessian -o test
}}}

Execute the code:

{{{
$ ./test
01234567890123456789012345678901
}}}

==Uninstall==

{{{
$ sudo make uninstall
}}}
